content:
Diagnosis
	1. Transverse colon adenocarcinoma, Duke's B
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Laparoscopic extended right hemicolectomy

	Chemotherapy
	1 Mar 2024 - ongoing CAPOX adjuvant chemotherapy

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	No evidence of disease

	Current issues
	Mild peripheral neuropathy

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today prior to cycle 4 of adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy. Treatment has been well tolerated with only grade 1 peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips. Performance status remains 0. Weight stable at 72kg. Blood results satisfactory for proceeding with treatment.

	Further investigations
	Routine CT surveillance scan booked for completion of treatment

	Medication prescribed
	Continue CAPOX at 100% doses

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 weeks pre cycle 5

	Required GP actions
	None required

status_updates.value: Duke's B transverse colon cancer post surgery, tolerating adjuvant CAPOX chemotherapy well with minimal toxicity
CT surveillance scan booked for completion of treatment
